intro: Peucedanum schlechteri, commonly known as Schlechter's angelica, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs such as parsley and dill. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers in umbel-like clusters. Its seeds are often used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is typically found in rocky or forested areas.
